With the start of our unconventional school year almost upon us, we take time to reflect because we have so much to be thankful for and proud of. Each week, we are truly humbled by a community who rises when faced with adversity. The City of Fairborn employees collecting school supplies for students who may need them; local churches and individuals making cloth masks for students who will need them; hundreds of cloth masks delivered to our buildings. Senior banner pickup for the Class of 2020. A second Skyhawk win for football on Friday night. Our "normal" has somewhat changed. But together we are embracing our school community. Sometimes, it is hard to capture in words what all this means. Our strong sense of community is something to be incredibly proud of. Our strong sense of community is something to be celebrated. We will get through this time together. We will be stronger as a result. Let's keep working together. Communicating. Sharing. Giving.
Proud to be Skyhawk Strong.
Proud.
Courageous.
Kind.
It's Who We Are.

#ForFairborn #SkyhawkVision2020 #SkyhawkPride

#ForFairborn #SkyhawkPride
shared_text:
Hill International
August 12 at 8:09 AM 路

In Fairborn, OH, the $30.9 million, 131,758 SF PK-2 Primary School is almost complete, with construction set to conclude later in August 2020! The new facility will serve over 1,200 students in pre-kindergarten to 2nd grade. The building features high-performance learning designs such as flexible spaces with operable walls, a small group room for every two classrooms, and extended learning areas in each academic wing of the building. The student dining area features a stage, a large projector screen, an interior slide, and checkerboard flooring for students to play large-scale matches of chess. Hill International is honored to be providing owners representative services for the construction of the new school. Project Manager Holly McLean says, It is nice to see what these modern school designs can bring to the students, staff, and communities we serve.

Our families safety and well being is our first and foremost priority. We would love for our children in this conference to have football and cheer but the risk of the current pandemic is too great to ignore. We have held off with high hopes that this season would indeed happen, but with the increases of COVID-19, we couldnt risk harming anyone in the WOJFC family.
We will continue to work hard in the upcoming months for future football possibilities (to include Spring). We thank you for your patience and understanding throughout this entire process....

This is a great life story about Angela Madsen, a Fairborn Baker High School graduate and proud member of the Class of 1978.

A common thread of passion and drive runs through her story. We see this tenacity in many of our graduates, overcoming adversity, living life to the fullest, and reaching out to others to make a difference.

Madsen played volleyball while at Baker High School, when the 1977 team was the Regional Runner-Up in the Ohio District tournament. Madsen was coached by former Fairborn Mayor and teacher/Athletic Director, Joan Dautel.

May Angela rest in peace. We honor a life well-lived, and she will certainly serve as an inspiration to all of us.

1985 Fairborn graduate and valedictorian, Dr. Rajeev Venkayya, continues to make us proud. His commitment to our nation's health and wellness has made a difference in the world!

Dr. Rajeev Venkayya is now the president of the global vaccine business unit for the Japan-based pharmaceutical company Takeda, but between 2005 and 2007 he was the director for biodefense under President George W. Bush.

Mei Lin (Finland)
Yudha (Indonesia)

There are two other student that hosted in FHS for 1 semester but they had to change school in the 2nd semester:
Yasar (Turkey) & YunHu (South Korea)

We really miss everyone in the school. We hope that our video could raise the awareness during this pandemic and our support to our beloved American High School.

We miss all of you and we hope to see you again in the future.
Thank you
Yudha Andayana

Some great infromation shared by our Fairborn Intermediate leadership:

For our parents: HOW DO I TEACH MY KIDS AT HOME?

First rule: Your kids don't have to be doing work from 8 a.m. to 2 p.m.

Here are some tips for you:

-Give yourself time to adjust.
-Create routines and stick with them. Let kids help with creating the routine.
-Assign the big kids to help the little kids with learning and playing.
-Adults might have to switch to doing things at home in the evenings.
-Set quiet time. Look up mindfulness meditation together on YouTube.
-Hold H-Hour or Horizontal Hour when we all lay down (in our own space) and read or rest - but no TV, no devices.
-Get outside more than once a day...for walks, play time, etc.

Check with different Homeschool resources online for more ideas. Again, grades are not the cornerstone or the goal of practicing at home.

Most of all, I want you to be reassured and calm with this recent change in all of our lives.

The great news keeps coming...even on the weekends!

Congratulations FCS Chess Club!

Fairbon is coming home with TROPHIES from the Queen City Classic! You heard that right, it's plural! 1 team and 3 individual. Matthew Wardle won 5th on a tie break, Avery Arwood won an individual trophy with 3.5 in place AND the 3rd place team for 4-6 under 800 rated. Rami Almohamedi came in 3rd for the 5th grade unrated section. Great job SKYHAWKS! Your #Chessfamily and community is cheering for you ALL! So VERY proud!
#Fairborn #Skyhawks #ComeSoarWithUs

Every day is a great day in the Fairborn City School District. Each day is filled with good people doing good work. Today is a great example. The organization "Shoes4TheShoeless" visited Baker Middle School today. Thank you to Mary Reaster, Board member and the Fairborn Lion's Club and all the community members who helped with sock donations....and to the "Shoes4TheShoeless" organization-we thank you for providing shoes for students in need. Can't say enough about our great kids-and our great community who supports our families.
What a great way to start the weekend.
www.Shoes4TheShoeless.org
#Fairborn #Skyhawks
